name: gusplease
text: This is the definitive example of Achewood's "wildly unexpected last panel" style of humor.

name: catachresis
text: I like that when we eventually meet Ray's mom, she is kind of like this.

name: ctrl_z
text: Like misspelling "Sandwiches"?

name: deimosrising
text: That paper has three sides what the fuck

name: dezufnocosem
text: maybe it uses similar technology to showbizs 4 sided wine divider sign

name: honesttom
text: Or Teador's baseball cards.

name: redjoker
text: I bet there's a sign on it that says "Hecho en Mexico"

name: twohundredninety
text: It looks like Pat's writing on a different sheet of paper, though. His is narrower -- there's not room for the "$8" underneath.

name: beansdooma
text: I think Pat was just carrying around that sign for whenever he needed to emphasize his lunch order.

name: dovey
text: Perfect. Chubby.

name: mbain3001
text: This in in fact the most obvious, beautiful observation on a strip I have ever seen.

name: origotoshi
text: I was reading back through the archives, saw this, and tried to give it a chubby. Sadly, I already did, and it won't let me give a second.

name: centipede_damascus
text: Ray's mom is extremely accepting of poor spelling as long as Ray tries his hardest.

name: petro
text: The last line is often used in parochial schools when teaching young kids "invented spelling."

name: tetrisattack
text: Ray and I both go into battle everyday fighting the war against not knowing how to spell certain everyday words.

name: scorpio_nadir
text: If you had misspelt a few words there, ti wood have ben gold.

name: 1000hz
text:
Ray accentuates the price just like he does his name in his signature.

=$8=

name: cdl146
text: Alt text: I wasn't originally supposed to do tonight's strip.

name: gussiejives
text: Now "Sammiches" is part of my lexicon.

name: honesttom
text: I recall it being a commonly-used word in the Scary-Go-Round comic strip.

name: tekende
text: It was used in Family Matters once. Urkel commented on Carl's sandwich, "That's a good-lookin' sammich you got there." And then he sneezed on it.

name: greenkoolayd
text: people have been saying the word sandwich wrong since it was invented.

name: atypicaloracle
text: I hear that John Montagu was particularly annoyed by this habit.

name: ashoykh
text: Alt interpretation of last panel is that Ray's mom thinks Ray is homeless.

name: cousinted
text: I could go for a sammich right about now

name: cousinted
text: Maybe a sanwich

name: molesticide
text:
the closest any living man will ever get to being a sultan in today's society is a pretty girl who, in about twenty minutes, will arrive home from school...

with a bag full of subs for me to consume.

i am so about to get my sammich on.

name: philosophe
text: The problem here is that you are 23 and named molesticide.

name: greenkoolayd
text: [[high5]] for hilariousness!

name: littlefatdog
text: Loving mothers are a significant contributor to the spread of various ignorance.

name: shoinan
text: This strip goes a hell of a long way to explaining the ethos of Ray.

name: brzbee
text: For eight dollars, those better be some rad sandwiches.

name: peterjoel
text: That crushing point in a child's development, when he realises that adults are not infallible...

name: zzzleepy
text: philippe had it right from the beginning

name: cf0
text:
Yeah, they'd probably sell more with "Sammiches" anyhow.


Sammiches!

name: peterjoel
text: The Good Lord knows to provide sandwiches

name: tom-ba
text: Its rad how your three stacked avatars all blink in unison!

name: ghede
text: The funny thing is that they are ALL right. Sandwiches, sandwitches, sammiches, samwiches, All are recognized spellings, although not by Firefox... the bastards.

name: donnatron
text: According to whom/what?

name: epicurus
text: I compressed the last panel into a very successful MSN avatar for a while, but I got awfully tired of explaining it to people and then they didn't have sex with me or anything .

name: heccibiggs
text:
How did you go about that? There are so many Achewood quotes and images that I wish I could make small enough to keep with me at all times.

Metaphorically speaking.

Maybe?

name: epicurus
text:
I just hit printscreen while that panel was in my screen, then opened MS paint and hit "paste" on a blank document, then cut out that panel with cut and pasted it into yet another new document, and then went about trimming it down to just the dialogue and kept resizing and shrinking and shifting it around until I had a nice, legible square.

It sounds like a hassle but if you try this it'll take you maybe six minutes at most once you get the hang of it.

name: snowman
text: I just realized I have really been taking PhotoShop for granted...

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
Yeah, no kidding.

Epicurus is clearly the dude from Circumstances.

name: epicurus
text: I... I never got Photoshop. When I was a kid, it was all taking screen captures from Dark Forces 2: Jedi Knight and opening them in MSpaint and adding humourous captions... oh good lord.

name: origotoshi
text:
Oh God that game was great. Racoonking! Red5!

:P

name: steerpike66
text: Ray's mother is kind of a fool. Like most nice church ladies.

name: donnatron
text: Philippe is an emotional rollercoaster in 3 panels. It really is amazing.

name: wonelove
text:
those are some rather pricy sammiches. Sanwiches
AH I'M CALLING MY MUM

name: dusty
text: You can't rightly say that without knowing the size composition or quantity of samdweeches that we are talking about.

name: stereo
text: Y'know, looking back, the art really has improved a lot.  I guess a direct contrast helps.

name: aaron_haynes
text: I got kind of a Pogo vibe from this one. It was a nice vibe, and I enjoyed getting it.

name: hpk
text: Thanks to this strip, all spellings of "sandwiches" look wrong to me now.
